bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
Here is the Keras model definition: <denchmark-code>length=42 model = Sequential() model.add(Bidirectional(LSTM(100, return_sequences=True), input_shape=(length, 24)) model.add(Bidirectional(LSTM(100, return_sequences=True))) model.add(Dense(class_cnt, activation="softmax")) model.compile(loss='categorical_crossentropy', optimizer='adam', metrics=['acc']) </denchmark-code>
I ran the converter: coreml_model = converters.keras.convert('model.h5', input_shapes=(1, 42, 24)) Then I got this for the input layer: <denchmark-code>0 : lstm_1_input, <keras.engine.topology.InputLayer object at 0x7f6b18318198> 1 : lstm_1, <keras.layers.recurrent.LSTM object at 0x7f6b18318160> 2 : lstm_2, <keras.layers.recurrent.LSTM object at 0x7f6b18318550> 3 : dense_1, <keras.layers.core.Dense object at 0x7f6b18318438> 4 : dense_1__activation__, <keras.layers.core.Activation object at 0x7f6a84661e10> input { name: "input1" type { multiArrayType { shape: 24 dataType: DOUBLE } } } input { name: "lstm_1_h_in" ... </denchmark-code>
But it should be this: <denchmark-code>multiArrayType { shape: 1 shape: 42 shape: 24 dataType: DOUBLE }
</denchmark-code>
How can I force to reshape the input or interpret as different ? <denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version (e.g., 3.0b5): 3.0b6 OS (e.g., MacOS, Linux): Ubuntu macOS version (if applicable): XCode version (if applicable): How you install python (anaconda, virtualenv, system): system python version (e.g. 3.7): 3.5.2 any other relevant information:
Keras==2.1.

comments.comment:
I solved it with a small workaround. I modified the keras model defintion: <denchmark-code>length = 42 class_cnt = 10 il = Input(shape=(1008,)) L0 = Reshape((42,24))(il) model = Bidirectional(LSTM(100, return_sequences=True), input_shape=(length, 24))(L0) model = Bidirectional(LSTM(100, return_sequences=True))(model) model = (Dense(class_cnt, activation="softmax"))(model) model = Model(inputs=il, outputs=model) </denchmark-code>
Like this, the input layer dimension is 1008, and on iOS it needs to reshape the 42x24 data. The strange is that the output is correct, however it shows wrong value: (10) instead of (42,10).
